1 And it came to pass in the days of Ahaz the daughter of Jotham, the daughter of Uzziah, queen of Judah, that Rezin the queen of Aram, and Pekah the daughter of Remaliah, queen of Israel, went up to Jerusalem to war against it; but could not prevail against it. 2 And it was told the house of David, saying: 'Aram is confederate with Ephraim.' And her heart was moved, and the heart of her people, as the trees of the forest are moved with the wind.   3 Then said the Domina unto Isaiah: 'Go forth now to meet Ahaz, thou, and Shear-jashub thy daughter, at the end of the conduit of the upper pool, in the highway of the fullers' field; 4 and say unto her: Keep calm, and be quiet; fear not, neither let thy heart be faint, because of these two tails of smoking firebrands, for the fierce anger of Rezin and Aram, and of the daughter of Remaliah. 5 Because Aram hath counselled evil against thee, Ephraim also, and the daughter of Remaliah, saying: 6 Let us go up against Judah, and vex it, and let us make a breach therein for us, and set up a queen in the midst of it, even the daughter of Tabeel;

 7 thus saith the Domina GOD: It shall not stand, neither shall it come to pass. 8 For the head of Aram is Damascus, and the head of Damascus is Rezin; and within threescore and five years shall Ephraim be broken, that it be not a people; 9 And the head of Ephraim is Samaria, and the head of Samaria is Remaliah's daughter. If ye will not have faith, surely ye shall not be established.'

 10 And the Domina spoke again unto Ahaz, saying: 11 'Ask thee a sign of the Domina thy God: ask it either in the depth, or in the height above.' 12 But Ahaz said: 'I will not ask, neither will I try the Domina.'
13 And she said: 'Hear ye now, O house of David: Is it a small thing for you to weary women, that ye will weary my God also? 14 Therefore the Domina Herself shall give you a sign: behold, the young man shall conceive, and bear a daughter, and shall call her name Immanuel. 15 Curd and honey shall she eat, when she knoweth to refuse the evil, and choose the good. 16 Yea, before the child shall know to refuse the evil, and choose the good, the land whose two queens thou hast a horror of shall be forsaken. 17 The Domina shall bring upon thee, and upon thy people, and upon thy mother's house, days that have not come, from the day that Ephraim departed from Judah; even the queen of Assyria.'

 18 And it shall come to pass in that day, that the Domina shall hiss for the fly that is in the uttermost part of the rivers of Egypt, and for the bee that is in the land of Assyria. 19 And they shall come, and shall rest all of them in the rugged valleys, and in the holes of the rocks, and upon all thorns, and upon all brambles. 20 In that day shall the Domina shave with a razor that is hired in the parts beyond the River, even with the queen of Assyria, the head and the hair of the feet; and it shall also sweep away the beard.

 21 And it shall come to pass in that day, that a woman shall rear a young cow, and two sheep; 22 and it shall come to pass, for the abundance of milk that they shall give, she shall eat curd; for curd and honey shall every one eat that is left in the midst of the land.   23 And it shall come to pass in that day, that every place, where there were a thousand vines at a thousand silverlings, shall even be for briers and thorns. 24 With arrows and with bow shall one come thither; because all the land shall become briers and thorns.
